questions.skill_area: Describe guiding principles for responsible AI
questions.question: Explain what is meant by transparency in AI and provide two concrete ways it can be implemented within an Azure AI solution.
questions.purpose: Assess understanding of transparency and real-world application in Azure AI.
scoring_criteria: Clearly defines transparency in AI.
Describes why transparency is important (e.g., trust, accountability).
Mentions at least one Azure tool or feature that aids transparency (e.g., interpretability tools, model explanations).
Provides two specific examples or methods to implement transparency.
Links transparency to positive impacts for users or stakeholders.

questions.skill_area: Describe guiding principles for responsible AI
questions.question: List three other principles of responsible AI besides transparency and briefly describe each.
questions.purpose: Test knowledge of the breadth of responsible AI principles.
scoring_criteria: Names at least three principles (e.g., fairness, privacy, accountability, reliability, inclusiveness, safety).
Briefly describes each principle.
Relates principles to AI system design or use.
Provides an example or context for at least one principle.

questions.skill_area: Describe guiding principles for responsible AI

scoring_criteria: Explains the role of documentation in responsible AI.

Provides a concrete example of documentation aiding responsible AI.

questions.skill_area: Describe features of computer vision workloads on Azure

questions.purpose: Test understanding of basic computer vision tasks and their application.
scoring_criteria: Correctly defines image classification.

questions.skill_area: Describe features of computer vision workloads on Azure

Mentions at least one Azure service supporting these tasks.
